page.title: 14HOP GROWING AT TYLER HILL
page.content: The hop garden is in the sheltered valley to the SE of Tyler Hill. Methods of growing,picking and drying have altered.Mechanisation has replaced labour.Cobs and Canterbury Goldings are the types grown here.Hops are trained on poles,wires and strings to grow at an angle to get maximum air and sun, and for ease in spraying to control pests and diseases.A worker still uses stilts to string the wires and poles, working 12 feet up between the rows.East- End Londoners used to hand pick the hop bines.A machine is now used. Hops are dried in oasthouses.Oil fired kilns with powerful fans dry the hops. Breweries use hops in the making of beer.The acreage has fallen from 52 to 20 since 1945. Hops have been grown at Tyler Hill at least since 1860.
